benchmark_details.name: Multi-Modal Retrieval-Augmented Generation (M2RAG)
benchmark_details.overview: M2RAG is a benchmark designed to evaluate the effectiveness of Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) in leveraging knowledge from multi-modal retrieval documents, comprising tasks such as image captioning, multi-modal question answering, multi-modal fact verification, and image reranking.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance the evaluation of retrieval-augmented generation in multi-modal contexts.

data.annotation: Annotated based on user queries and related multi-modal documents.

methodology.calculation: Calculated using standard evaluation metrics for each task as discussed in the methodology section of the paper.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in correctly leveraging retrieved multi-modal documents for generation tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance of models like MiniCPM-V 2.6 and Qwen2-VL on the M2RAG benchmark shows significant improvements after applying MM-RAIT.
methodology.validation: Ensured through comparative analysis with existing benchmarks.
